5.verse_text: O Lord , reflect on what has happened to us; consider and look at our disgrace. foreigners now occupy our homes. we must buy our own wood at a steep price. we are weary and have no rest. in order to buy food to eat. but we suffer their punishment. there is no one to rescue us from their power. because robbers lurk in the countryside. due to a fever from hunger. elders were mistreated. boys stagger from their labor. because of these things, we can hardly see through our tears. renew our life as in days before, and are angry with us beyond measure.
Our inheritance is turned over to strangers;

We have become fatherless orphans; our mothers have become widows. virgins in the towns of Judah. the young men have stopped playing their music. our dancing is turned to mourning. woe to us, for we have sinned! which lies desolate. your throne endures from generation to generation. Why do you forsake us so long?
We must pay money for our own water;
We are pursued – they are breathing down our necks;
We have submitted to Egypt and Assyria
Our forefathers sinned and are dead,
Slaves rule over us;
At the risk of our lives we get our food
Our skin is hot as an oven
They raped women in Zion,
Princes were hung by their hands;
The young men perform menial labor;
The elders are gone from the city gate;
Our hearts no longer have any joy;
The crown has fallen from our head;
Because of this, our hearts are sick;
For wild animals are prowling over Mount Zion,
But you, O Lord , reign forever;
Why do you keep on forgetting us?
Bring us back to yourself, O Lord , so that we may return to you;
